fact_text: The death toll is now reportedly at seven after at least two tornadoes touched down in Tennessee. At least seven people were reportedly killed early Tuesday morning after at least two tornadoes touched down. Tornadoes tore through Nashville and central Tennessee overnight, with press reports on Tuesday indicating the death toll rising to 22, with 'hundreds displaced from their homes and dozens of buildings damaged or destroyed'

TEMA declared a level three state of emergency for Tennessee after deadly tornadoes ripped through Nashville and Cookeville early Tuesday morning. Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee has declared a state of emergency following overnight tornadoes in the Nashville area that took the lives of at least 19 people. A Level 3 State of Emergency has been declared for Tennessee after tornadoes and severe storms rocked the Nashville area, according to the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency.

At least two tornadoes touched down in Tennessee, there is severe damage near downtown Nashville. Massive damage left in the wake of several tornadoes that touched down in and around Nashville, Tennessee. Early this morning there were reports that at least one tornado touched down just northwest of Nashville, Tennessee. WHILE YOU WERE SLEEPING: At least two tornadoes touched down overnight in Tennessee, including one that caused damage near downtown Nashville.

Major structural damage was reported as the tornado moved through downtown and into Wilson County to the east. Over 40 structures have been reported collapsed and a few people have died due to a tornado that touched down in Nashville early this morning. Significant structural damage has been reported and at least 9 fatalities by 8 tornadoes across middle Tennessee so far; https://www.severe-weather.eu/recent-events/destructive-tornado-nashville-tennessee-mk/

Tennessee Declares State of Emergency After Tornado Hits Near Nashville https://t.co/6TnyritPnt. Severe tornadoes broke out last night with significant damage throughout the area including lost lives and injuries. Tornadoes killed at least 6, and have damaged 40 buildings.

update: 3/4/20 24 reported dead with more people missing =( #DEVELOPING - AT LEAST 19 PEOPLE KILLED IN #Tennessee TORNADO STORM. CNN reports 22 people have died and more are missing after storms and a tornado tore through the area Monday night and into Tuesday morning. Cookeville Mayor Ricky Shelton has released a list of 77 names of people who are missing after overnight storms that produced tornadoes.

Tornado on the ground for 10 minutes, homes and businesses destroyed, 9 lives lost. 
. Nashville hit hard by tornado that reportedly stayed on the ground for more than hour. The tornado reportedly stayed on the ground into Hermitage, about 10 miles east of the city. Early reports are saying the tornado stayed on the ground, wreaking havoc for almost an hour. Early damage reports suggest the tornado stayed on the ground for 10 miles.

We are sending support to the families impacted by the tornado. BIRMINGHAM LEGION FC COLLECTING ITEMS FOR NASHVILLE VICTIMS Legion FC and the Magic City Brigade are joining the relief effort and collecting items of need following the tornadoes that hit Nashville early this morning, March 3. Ways to Help Following Deadly Tornado There are numerous community organizations available to accept volunteers, donations and other aid for those impacted by Tuesday’s tornado.

There are 48,000 outages around the Nashville area due to the tornado last night. At least 5 people have been killed after reported tornadoes hit the Nashville area amid reports of significant damage and power outages. Tornado damage has been reported throughout West and Middle Tennessee including downtown Nashville, TN. IMPACTS Power – Current reported power outages Davidson County is reporting approximately 44,500 without power.

The strongest tornado in the region has a preliminary rating of EF3 with a max wind to 165 mph. Looking at the early storm damage pictures, it looks like it was at least an EF-2 tornado with wind of 111+ mph. This tornado, which appears to be the strongest as it passes east of Nashville and within about 4 miles south of the Doppler radar, had radar estimated wind values of up to 133mph in one direction and up to about 160mph shear values at certain points within reasonable distance.

Volunteers are needed for recovery and clean-up in Nashville after a devastating EF-3 tornado. The tornado recovery efforts in Middle TN are just starting. ACS DR teams from the Southern Union Conference, and Georgia-Cumberland, Kentucky-Tennessee, and South Central conferences get involved in the Recovery Efforts in aftermath of the deadly tornadoes that hit central Tennessee early this morning.

Nashville's Emergency Operations Center announced it had opened an emergency shelter with running water in a farmer's market to help displaced residents.

. 6:30 Update - If you have been displaced by the storm and have a pet we are located at two emergency shelter locations. **There are relief shelters at Opry Mills and Centennial Sportplex for those in need. Several shelters in the area have been opened for displaced people.

As of this moment, at least 19 confirmed deaths and many, many injuries due to the tornado outbreak overnight. So many lives lost from this tornado outbreak.
With the tornado going through Nashville, Tennessee in the early morning hours, it’s a good time to review where tornado shelters are located throughout town.

The Disaster Distress Helpline can provide immediate support and crisis counseling to anyone who wants help dealing with ongoing effects of the tornadoes in Nashville, Tennessee. Due to the State of Emergency just declared, and the severe damage from tornadoes in Nashville and Cookeville, we have reached out to our contacts at Nashville Humane and AARF in Cookeville to determine how we can help.

Metro Nashville Public Schools WILL BE CLOSED today due to tornado damage. Following the Nashville tornado, TLC is CLOSED all day today (March 3rd). Metro schools will be closed today  due to tornado damage. Metro Schools will be closed Tuesday due to tornado damage throughout the county. Schools are closed today, Tuesday, March 3 due to tornado damage.

Road signs along I-440 are also down, and considerable damage has been reported. DOWNTOWN CLOSURES-- Storm damage is widespread, and has closed many roads across the region, including some in downtown Nashville. Neighborhoods are flattened; highways are littered with overturned semis; and emergency crews are responding to over 40 reports of building collapses. However, I am hearing reports of major damage around Lebanon with many roads blocked.

40+ buildings destroyed after a tornado outbreak. Several people are dead and 40 buildings are destroyed after a tornado tore through Nashville, Tennessee, on March 3. 8 people were killed and at least 40 structures collapsed after a powerful tornado tore through Tennessee overnight
https://t.co/AQ99OuM0sI. The tornado caused damage to 100-150 structures and search and rescue crews are going door to door.
